newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan money rates end up on more NCD issue.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan money rates end up on more NCD issue.

text.p: Taiwan's money rates closed higher on Friday amid increased efforts by the central bank to issue negotiable certificates of deposit to mop up excess liquidity, dealers said.
The overnight interbank rate finished at 5.321 percent against Thursday's 5.234 close, with 30-day commercial paper at 5.25-5.30 percent against 5.10-5.15.
The central bank on Friday issued T$3 billion of NCDs, just one day after it issued T$8 billion of NCDs which had caused Thursday's reserve excess to show a negative T$6.4 billion, dealers said.
Dealers said if the central bank continued its NCD moves next week, rates likely would move up toward 5.5 percent.
The benchmark 10-year 86/4 bond yield was at 5.917-920 percent against Thursday's 5.90 close.
